All Superinterfaces:
IAuditable, IAuditableHandle, IItem, IItemHandle, IManagedItem, IManagedItemHandle, INamed, IProcessContainer, IProcessContainerHandle, IProcessDefinitionHandle, IProcessItem, IProcessItemHandle
public interface IProcessDefinition
extends IProcessDefinitionHandle, IProcessContainer

A process definition consists of

  • the process id
  • the definition of the process details
  • the schema of the settings the process supports
  • the list of process domains belonging to this process
As the set of item types and platform operations is extensible, the activities and resources governed by a process are extensible. To embrace this extensibility of coverage, processes are extensible. The unit of process extensibility is a process domain. A process domain logically bundles a set of process aspects. E.g., a process domain may contain all process aspects that are related to the creation and management of work items - we would refer to it as the work item domain of the process. The extensibility of processes translates into the extensibility of process definitions. The process definition provides access to a set of process domain definitions extending it.

Since:
0.5

Field Detail

ITEM_TYPE

static final IItemType ITEM_TYPE
The process definition item type.

PROCESS_ITERATION_URL

static final java.lang.String PROCESS_ITERATION_URL
The key into the definition data for the URL of the process iteration content. The URL can be relative to the repository location.
